ARABIC: وَكَانُوا۟ يَنْحِتُونَ مِنَ ٱلْجِبَالِ بُيُوتًا ءَامِنِينَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: They carved out houses from the mountains, feeling safe,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: They used to hew dwellings in the mountains to live in security.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: They used to hew out houses from the mountains and lived in security.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: They would carve secure houses out of the mountains.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And they used to carve dwellings in the hills, without fear.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And they used to hew out dwellings from the mountains, (feeling) secure.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And they hewed houses in the mountains in security.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: They were hewing the mountains into houses, therein dwelling securely;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And they used to hew out dwellings from the hills, (wherein they dwelt) secure.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: They carved out dwellings in the mountains, and lived in security --
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And they were hewing out houses from mountains feeling secure.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: They used to hew out dwellings from mountains feeling secure.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Out of the mountains did they hew (their) edifices, (feeling themselves) secure.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And they used to hew out dwellings from the mountains (feeling themselves) secure.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: They hewed their dwellings out of the mountains in safety.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: They used to carve homes in the mountains, feeling secure.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And they used to carve from the mountains, houses, feeling secure.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [15:82] And they used to hew out dwellings from the mountains, feeling secure.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: And they used to hew out dwellings from the hills) from the mountains, (wherein they dwelt) secure) in the sense that they were safe from their collapse; it is also said that this means: safe from the torment. 279
